name: overmedicated
text: Oh god, i totally forgot aobut the badass games!

name: zefiel
text: Because they fell too close to the shadow of the Great Outdoor Fight.

name: straw
text: And I feel also because they were directly on the tails of the vestigial dong.  Rock and hard place, people.  Rock and a hard place.

name: connellingus
text: So the hard place is between a rock and this arc?

name: gsail11
text: Rock and a hard dong even

name: dougthehead
text: I've been known to rock a hard dong from time to time.

name: killerlimpet
text: agreed

name: missdove
text: I felt that they were a sort of offshoot of the GOF... a consolation prize to the guys who didn't attend.

name: carbonation
text: And they turned out to not be quite as annual as they claimed.

name: epicurus
text: Yeah, the badass games were overshadoew a bit by the GOF. The idea seemed redundant at first (given the GOF) but later events proved that it was not.

name: catachresis
text: Anything where Cornelius gets to show his massive sack of badass is so far away from redundant that it has to use a special phonecard

name: taskmaster
text: I take it the "massive sack of badass" in not concealed within his jowly chin?

name: chaesar
text: That was my exact first thought too, I was gearing up to comment basically the same thing you said. [chubby]

name: stormagnet
text: Rather than redundant, my impression was that Ray was founding the logical successor, having burned the GOF to the ground and salted its ashes and all.

name: agika
text: Is Lyle perpetually passed out and pissing on himself?

name: saurkraus
text: Yes.

name: tomsonlocal
text: Lyle is CRAFTY.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Lyle is 2-pissed when he's asleeep and 3-pissed when he's awake.

name: featurelessvoid
text: You say that like it's a bad thing.

name: skavid
text: Heh. Classic Lyle.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Ahahaha Pat's door.

name: cicadalek
text: He is an escaped felon, to be fair.

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: notice when he got electocuted by Lyle and Phillipe:  he has an extra chain lock on his bathroom door.

name: farqussus
text: Vlad's door. Is he hoping being a notary is goink to help with ladies?

name: aliiis
text: Pat's irritation!

name: tonyhighwind
text: Five locks and a baseball bat.

name: delzhand
text: Vlad is notary public?  I am havink a hard time seeink it.

name: isunklower
text: No way - notary publics are definitely king of the make-outs. I signed up to be one a couple years back. Drunkenly stamped people on the forehead at parties. It was great.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: ...Really?   Wow.

name: catachresis
text: 4 just for Pat's locks

name: caduceo
text: Teodor is a total nerd. two computer screens and a radio on top of his computer tower? I love how pats door has 5 different kind of locks. And lyle looks so peaceful, like a little angel.

name: quinlaenar
text: Of course he has two computer screens. How else would he look over Ray's shoulder?

name: numberkillinger
text: also, having two monitors is completely the bomb.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
It's true, one no longer has to pass stringent Nerdcore qualifications to be cleared for having two monitors for one computer.

Truly, we live in a golden age.

name: laserblade
text: He's a graphic designer.  He needs the screen real estate to do his job.

name: hollybones
text: Why does Teodor have claws?

name: gormster
text: He's a bear .

name: hollybones
text: Yeah, a stuffed bear.

name: dovey
text: I doubt that's Teodor's hand. Check other comics where you can see the cats' hands.

name: mugi
text: So, since we can assume that Lyle is still passed out, that must be a scene-change to Pat.

name: alzuna
text: I dunno, Pat is wearing a short sleeved shirt and it looks like those hands are attached to arms with long sleeves...Or am I being too picky here? I'm being too picky...

name: holly_golightly
text: I don't think so, in other comics where Teador's hands are drawn he's had claws like this. These claws are longer and more narrow than any of the cats'.

name: taskmaster
text:
but Teadore is supposed to be a bear... I mean they have claws but they are usually these huge blunt things, not sleek retractable cat claws like the ones we see.

...come to think of it how the hell does he cook with those?

name: imitationcrab
text: Lie Bot was not invited.  What gives?  He probably could have dominated the Rap with a Con portion.

name: professorhazard
text: At work the other day, I realized that Lie Bot was not invited to the Badass Games. In that same thought, I realized that it was because he would have handily won them.

name: closefriend
text: Vlad is a pawnbroker? Seems like that would require mad starting capital.

name: jaldor
text: What? Come on dude, use a dictionary. Otherwise someday you're gonna go get a marriage license and come back with two ceramic clowns and a broken clock and your fiancee is going to straight-up dump you because who wants to marry a dude who's got no word-ability?

name: jaldor
text: Oh wow I totally misread that and saw "pawnshop". don't I feel like a fool. Sorry for the sass.

name: seanbad
text: "First Annual Badass Games," June 2006. It's half-past July 2007 now, where's the second Games?

name: dasilodavi
text: If you want to ask that you should first ask why we don't hear about the 2007 GOF.

name: semiquaver
text: You probably just didn't hear about it because you just got back from the 2007 Bitch About Failing to Pointlessly Rehash Old Storylines competition.

name: solobuttons
text: I like Pat's look of fury at being invited to the Games. What a couple of fools!

name: neitherman
text: He feels like he doesn't need to be told he's badass.

name: coldfrog
text: Yet, 24 hours later, he arrives just the same.

name: luckypyjamas
text: so is the second half written on the back of the card then?

name: lateadopter
text: The back is visible in three panels, with no writing.  It's a fancy card, like a wedding invitation, with an interior flap.

name: edjarosu
text:
Anybody else see shades of Snow Crash in that invitation?

"Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live,devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad."

Intentional or just a happy accident, I sure smile whenever I read something like that.

name: saru
text: Had the exact same response.

name: c_dizzle
text: Is Vlad notary?

name: dovey
text:
It says "Notary" on his door.

I'm going to hazard a guess and say he is.

name: molesticide
text: is liquid pouring out of pat's doorknob?

name: slab64
text: I think that's the kind of lock that braces against the floor. It's just awkward perspective.

name: meetzorp
text: I'm pretty sure that's a baseball bat jammed up underneath the doorknob.

name: buttermoths
text: Liquid sure has been pouring out of Kyle's knob, HEYO!

name: buttermoths
text: LYLE! OH GOD OH CRAP AW MAN

name: taiiga
text: onstad circa early 2006, you were on to something.. on to the EDGE

name: hendetta
text: Man why would they even invite Pat.

name: mangtastic
text:
To humiliate him, maybe. Take him down a peg or two after he knows he isn't a badass.

Of course, it probably would not work that way. Pat would sneer and pan off the badass games as nonsense and poorly executed (to Pat, a true badass doesn't eat cheese and listens to everything Moby says).
Fuck Pat.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: To get him off the street from murdering Roast Beef?

name: tollschaft
text: I keep imagining the 'FFT' noise the letter makes as it slides under the door.

name: lolsworth
text: My favourite arc. As if you gave a shit.
